page.title: 17MINING IN ESTON HILLS
page.content: On our{explorations}of the area we found{evidence}of the{mining industry which used to take place here.There are several{ruined buildings}and we also found three blocked off{tunnels leading into the hillside.Two of these were quite large,rather like{railway {tunnels.}The mines were{ironstone mines. We noticed that in many of the {streams}the water and mud was an {orangey colour.}This is caused by the ironstone in the hills.Also you can see places where the land has{subsided due to the mining. When the{mines}first opened in the early{1900's}people came from all over the country to work here. To get to work the men had to climb up{Eston Hills}because the cage they went down in was at a place called{Pit {Top or Barnaby Moor.
